description: Variation of Condition 2 (Approved Plans) for revised drawings for planning permission 01504/AF/P34 (P/2019/3115) dated 15/10/2019 for the erection of new gantry to accommodate additional external mechanical and electrical plant infrastructure to support 7.8MW up-grading work to existing Data Centre
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [C1052-SK-A-001; C1052-SK-A-004; C1052-SK-A-006; C1052-SK-A-007; cur/2565/7.8MW DandA; PWH/jas/1426R/4688/A; AQ_assessment/2019/Feltham_data_centre V3. Received: 23/08/2019; Design and Access Statement and Noise Impact Assessment. Received on 17/10/2023; 2843-PL-205 and 2843-PL-206. Received on 27/10/2023; Air Quality Assessment. Received on 22/02/2024; 2843-PL-201 Rev A and 2843-PL-200 Rev A. Received on 01/03/2024; Feltham Data Centre Noise Assessment. Received on 08/03/2024; Fire Statement. Received on 22/03/2024; 2843-PL-202 Rev B, 2843-PL-203 Rev A, 2834-PL-204 Rev A and Feltham Data Centre Noise Assessment. Received on 30/09/2024].

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development hereby approved shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance (SPG) 'Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' dated July 2014, or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.  

The development shall also demonstrate that the proposed development is complaint with Building Emissions Benchmark (BEBs), specified in the GLA's Supplementary Planning Guidance "Sustainable Design and Construction" dated April 2014). 

Reason: In the interests of air quality and to protect neighbours' living conditions and the wider local environment.

Condition : 5 - External noise from machinery

The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development hereby permitted shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014+A1:2019 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

A post installation noise assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the sound criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to first use of the plant equipment hereby approved and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the site, surrounding premises and neighbours' are not adversely affected by noise from plant equipment.

Condition : 6 - Anti-vibration mounts and silencing of machinery

Prior to use of the plant, machinery or equipment at the development hereby permitted shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the site, surrounding premises and neighbours' are not adversely affected by noise from plant equipment.

Condition : 7 - Emergency generator use and testing times

The emergency generators shall only be operated for their intended use as stated in the "T.P. Architects" Design + Access Statement (Project: LON 1 Serverfarm 2843-02-01), and will remain in stand-by mode, other than during testing. Testing of the emergency generator shall only occur for a period of 1 hour per month, and only between the hours of 08:00 to 18:00 on Mondays to Fridays. No testing shall take place on Saturdays, Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the site, surrounding premises and neighbours' are not adversely affected by noise from plant equipment.
